review_text: Lots of local bars within walking distance. Quick tip about the washer, always put on quick wash and then when it’s finished washing put it on spin mode only to get all of the water out of your clothes. Lastly, for the dryer put it on bulk bedding so that it completely dries your clothes in one setting. Overall a great stay for the price and location. I would highly recommend without any reservations. Hailee was a great host and thanks for having me.

name: Victoria
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
February 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I enjoyed staying at this Airbnb, everything was very clean and accessible, with a surprising amount of space (enough to workout). Great location, right around the corner from Little Palace! Columbus-wise, this is a very central location— short drive/cheap uber to anything you need to go to.
Small snacks, coffee/tea, and Brita filter are much appreciated! Plus a very soft makeup removal washcloth. There’s a good amount of closet space to store your personal items out of the way.
There are two key-fob entrances to go through before getting to the unit, which provides additional safety. The lock on the door to the apartment is 4-digit code. There is no deadbolt or additional lock, so I brought a travel lock with me since I was traveling alone. My generic travel lock worked just fine!
Thank you Hailee, I loved your unit! It made me feel right at home. Xx

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Garden Villa was even better than expected! We were able to totally relax in the area we were in and The Villa seemed to just be a little haven away from the hustle of nearby activities. We had a ton of snow dump on us overnight our 2nd night there which transformed the look to a beautiful winter wonderland. Simon warned us the snow was coming and advised us to park at the top of the hill leading down to The Garden Villa. We heeded his advice and were very grateful for the information. He was extremely proactive and prevented what could have been a difficult situation for us the next day as we were attending a conference in the morning. We are trying to come up with a good reason to visit in warmer weather simply because our stay was so enjoyable! There were so many windows yet we were able to enjoy total privacy once the blinds were closed. I cannot recommend this highly enough. Thank you for making this a great, long weekend Simon. Stay here, you won’t be disappointed!

If your looking for a relaxing stay I highly recommend staying at this guesthouse. It’s close to the amenities of Dublin and Worthington, and an easy drive from 270, but still provides a private oasis. The gardens are beautiful, even in the winter, and they provide a peaceful setting.
Simon was great to work with and the suite is luxurious. His listing notes the King bed with a 12 in thick mattress and ThermaRest pillows … I have to say this was one of the most comfortable beds I’ve slept on. The sheets are super soft too. I also loved the hand soap, a small detail, but it made me feel pampered. This AirB&B is a hidden gem, and I will definitely stay here again.

Everything is high end and well thought out: bed, furniture, decor, linens and towels, tv and all kitchenette accessories. Everything we needed was available. Very quiet and peaceful spot and the right location for what we planned on doing and we will be back for sure. Thanks Simon for providing a memorable experience.

We had a fantastic time! This was our last babymoon trip and we were extremely happy and satisfied with Simon's listing. It was beautiful this time of year but we could only imagine how gorgeous and pretty it is during the blooming months to see all the plants outside and also enjoy the outside amenities. We even saw some wildlife, deer, close by in the side yard. Definitely picturesque! The inside was crisp, clean, and cozy giving off a warm, homey vibe. All the amenities were great, easy to use and high quality.
Location wise, it was easy to get to and very close a big area with restaurants, shopping, malls, etc while also being ~15 minutes away from the downtown. This made it easy to find some delicious food, explore the Zoo's Wildlights and visit COSI.
Simon's communication before, during and faster was fantastic. They made everything so easy and responded quickly.
One of our favorite airbnb's thus far! High recommend!

review_text: A gorgeous and intimate stay for two! My fiancé and I enjoyed a long weekend at The Garden Villa to celebrate our recent engagement. The property is tucked away on the edge of a gorgeous country club surrounded by trees and wildlife. We enjoyed the sounds of birds and other creatures rustling around the leaves during our stay. The inside of the property was absolutely immaculate, by far the cleanest property I have had the pleasure to stay at. The bed was comfortable, the linens were clean, and amenities were easily accessible. The gem of the stay is for sure the outdoor clawfoot tub! What a dream it was relaxing in a private bath outdoor in nature. The host Simon was extremely responsive and offered great local recommendations. The property is equipped with Ring door sensors but it did not feel invasive and did not impact our stay in any way. We would definitely return to this property when in need of a quiet weekend away. Thank you again to the host Simon!

review_text:
This is the first time I have used Airbnb, my husband and I wanted to take a couple days away for our 1 year anniversary. I honestly thought the pictures were too good to be true but The Garden Villa was a dream. I loved walking out every morning to the fountains and the atmosphere. The location is inside the property of a golf course which was odd when we first pulled in, but past that you never think about it. That being said, you will need to drive to go places but we never drove more than 15 minutes. The bridge district and zoo were both close, plus countless restaurants and shops. We are thinking about booking again next year because it was so perfect.
The hosts are very responsive, we had a small issue with the tv remote battery being dead and they came down and fixed it within minutes.
The villa was very clean and the only thing it lacked was a lightning cable on the charger dock provided.

review_text:
The Villa was just what we needed, a quiet getaway spot. It was easy to check in, and cozy for what we needed.
The internet is there, maybe not the best, but also not the main point of being in such a beautiful spot. And this place is slightly harder than some to get delivery to, but the host has specific recommendations ahead of time for that which worked excellently when we tried it.
Everything was very clean, very comfortable. The bed was super comfortable! They did a good job making such a compact space feel bigger with the high ceilings and lots of natural light (but also the ability to cover most windows, so the best of both worlds). Location is a very short drive to lots of things.
The property is of course very pretty. I’d love to be there a couple of months later when things are fully blooming and also in the snow too. I bet it’s even better.
We would definitely recommend this place to one or two people traveling in the Columbus area! It’s a find!

review_text: Stayed at Simon’s Villa to celebrate a birthday, as we travelled a couple of hours to the Columbus area for a quick getaway. I only needed one night, but paid for the 2 night minimum, as the Villa looked peaceful and gorgeous. I would regularly plan a stay at the Villa, if there was flexibility for a 1 night stay (dang kids)! I did give 4/5 stars for value, only due to how little we were actually at the Villa - if we had stayed at the Villa for the entirety of our time in Columbus, it would have been 5/5, but that logic could be applied to any Airbnb. We hope to return in a few months, just to enjoy more time at the Villa, as the Villa alone would be worth the trip. I was extremely happy with our stay, and Simon was a fantastic host. We had everything we needed, the communication was proactive and very clear, Simon was extremely attentive, and even recommended a great place to stop for lunch in the area. I thank Simon for everything he did to make our stay what I had hoped for & more!

We had snacks and coffee available after our long drive and everything was as described - or possibly even lovelier than the photos.
The area is full of fun restaurants and activities and Simon provided some helpful tips. Check-out was simple and easy.
All in all, we are extremely happy. This was a special treat and we are looking forward to coming back.

review_text: What a lovely villa!! It’s tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Dublin, but still minutes from any and all the fun things you want to do while there. This place has all the amenities you could want! Even a power charging station; a first for us when staying at an Airbnb. The bed and bedding was so comfortable, and the kitchen and bathroom had every amenity you can think of. We had to reach out to our host at one point around 8:30 in the evening because I locked the doorknob which caused the keypad to be ineffective at unlocking our door. He was very gracious and understanding and had us back inside within minutes. The only tip I can offer is the driveway to the villa is a tad narrow, so if you have a large vehicle it might take a moment to leave. But we will definitely consider staying here again when planning another visit to Dublin!

Rating, 4 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Garden. The grounds were beautiful, and the room was clean and upgraded. Simon was a wonderful host and provided information about the area and places to visit. He also answered our questions quickly when we reached out about the claw foot tub.
The only reasons we gave our stay 4 stars instead of 5 was because the room did have a smaller bathroom. Both my wife and I had had difficulties moving around in the space even when we were in there individually. We also think the water was on well water because there was a distinct smell from the water. This isn’t something that they would be able to change though, but I just wanted to provide that information in case anyone else is sensitive to smells like my wife! The other thing that we weren’t a huge fan of was the AC because it was more of a wall mount type. It seemed to take longer to get the space to cool off. There also seemed to be some wifi issues because the television apps ran off wifi and would freeze or skip at points.
Overall, the space truly was beautiful. While we didn’t particularly enjoy Columbus in general for completely unrelated reasons, the one thing we did enjoy was getting to spend quality time together in the Garden.

This place is beautiful and spotless! It is in a nice area, close to plenty of restaurants, bars, shopping areas, etc. while still feeling secluded. The host communicates well and is very informative about the area.
I do want to mention that there were small planes flying over for a good amount of the evening that we spent there. More of an annoyance than anything. The property also wasn't as well groomed on the outside as it was in the photos, and the parking area is very small. You have to do some maneuvering in order to get out unless you're good at backing up hills.
Overall, a little on the expensive side, but still a great place to stay.

As for the entrance, it was precisely as described by the host—easy to locate and access, which made our check-in seamless and hassle-free. In conclusion, we were thoroughly pleased with our stay. The combination of a clean, comfortable space, accurate listing, and the unexpected serenity amidst a lively location made this Airbnb experience truly enjoyable.

I highly recommend this place for those who are looking for an affordable Airbnb in Columbus and a super host!

review_text: I enjoyed staying at Chantal-Marie's place. The room was truly "lovely." I greatly appreciated the peace and quiet, and the mature post oak tree in the backyard. I appreciated that I had a choice whether to have A/C or open windows, and there were no heavy perfumed sheets or anything like that. I very much like how there was a glass water jar set up in the bedroom and coffee/tea maker for individual use. I found the place to have everything I need with very simple and easy check in/out. I'd definitely stay there again if I was looking for a quiet place and some solitude near Columbus.

review_text:
Chantal-Marie's place is a great value when needing a place to put your head. The room was good and the bed comfortable. There is the possibility that there will be other Airbnb'ers there also, so it is possible that there will be 3 guest rooms that share one bathroom. This never posed an issue during my two night stay.
The value is very good, though. Chantal-Marie met me in person when I arrived and showed me to my room. The room was comfortable with a coffee maker and a common microwave in the hall right outside the door. They also have a refrigerator in the kitchen where guests can store stuff. The front door has a keypad so access is pretty seamless. All in all, a good stay.

Regarding the location, it was a little far from the place where the festival took place, but my friends were in a nearby hotel and everything worked out perfectly because I was picking them up by Uber and we stayed at the nearest bus stop and from there it was only $2 for the stadium. Everything was very good in general, the room, the bathroom impeccable. If I go back to the festival from the other year, I would definitely stay again at Chantal.

Everything was as described down to creamer for coffee and even condiments in the fridge. The home was pristine and even my kids said it was the best sleep they’ve gotten in weeks (same for me). We worked on a jigsaw puzzle over the weekend and my kids didn’t even worry about having the tv on. We enjoyed sitting on the patio outside and watching the bumblebees in the flowers. The drive to West Jefferson and even into Columbus was easy! Dorothy gave some suggestions for local eats and even some activities happening over the weekend. It was the perfect weekend getaway from the busyness of life! We would definitely stay again.

It is mid west country living at it finest but is so close to several towns/cities and has very easy access to I-70 between Columbus and Springfield. If safety is a priority in your search or if you are traveling alone, this space, neighborhood, extended area is as safe as one could get, in my opinion. They have thought of everything one could need and more.
Dorothy and David are so warm and personable. The space was private yet we so enjoyed our brief interactions with them. Check in was simple with a key pad and very clear instructions about parking and entry. I hope it is available the next time we are traveling to this area.

Would definitely choose their place again, even thought it was 30 mins away from the zoo...it was so worth it instead of staying in the city closer because it was very peaceful!

review_text: The urban is a nice hotel in a great location. It was very close to short north, northern market and the Ohio state campus. The apartment has a lot of amenities such as a 24 hour gym, a fire pit, and a hot tub. Our least favorite part of our stay was locating the Urban. There is a lot of construction going on around the building so there were detours; We’re not locals and the instructions they gave us were not very helpful. We eventually ended up finding the place and the garage. The room was small, but very nice and includes things such as a tv, a microwave and a refrigerator. The walls were thin, and we could hear people in the rooms near us. All in all, the urban was a nice place to stay in our less than 2 day trip to Columbus.

Stayed one night
review_text: I will start by saying, we came at a time where there was a lot of construction going on. It was hard to locate the building because it was sandwiched between several other places and kind of hidden. Between it not being an obvious stand out and there being barricades for construction, it was hard to find. Moving to the actual location: The amenities and the floor where our room was, had lots of seating and a very cute aesthetic. Moving to the actual room itself, very very small. This is not the place to stay if you’re coming with more than 2 people and plan to stay for a long period, comfortably. The space consist of a bed, sink, and small bathroom. Not much room for anything extra. We only stayed overnight so it was good for that purpose. Construction woke us up at 6am, which would’ve been nice to know prior to booking. There were HUGE TOENAILS in the AC unit. And it was very hot in the room. Disgusting. But otherwise clean. I’d do it again for one night, nothing longer.

Stayed one night
review_text: My husband and I were in Columbus for the evening. Booked this location based on reviews. Something different than our usually downtown stays. Reviews were accurate. Current construction in front of the property made entry a little difficult. Nothing major though. Check-in was a breeze and staff was very friendly and welcoming. You even get a free mini Jeni's ice cream upon arrival :) Nice! Property as described. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Everything you need for an overnight stay. The common/kitchenarea on the 6th floor is pretty cool! Found out that part of the building is tenant apartments and part is hotel rentals. Great idea. The only issue we had was parking my husband's truck. AT4 that barely clears the 7 foot entry. Garage clearance got lower each level 6'9/6'10. Talked to the front desk and they were happy to accommodate our vehicle in the first level parking. Overall we had a GREAT stay and would return again. Perfect for our stay and excellent price.

review_text: My fiance and I had a wonderful stay in German village! The home was perfect for what we needed! The bed was very comfy and the whole house was very clean. We had no problems and didn't need to reach out to the host for anything but I'm sure he would've responded in a kind and timely manner. There were many amenities provided. There were soaps and shampoos and extra linens. All the necessary appliances were included in the kitchen and I appreciated that ground coffee was available to use. It was a short walking distance to all the desirable destinations in German village. There was construction going on during the days but that didn't bother us. Overall we really enjoyed the home and would definitely visit again in the future!

We especially enjoyed drinking our coffee in the morning while sitting on the upper level deck outside the bedroom watching the ducks in the neighbor's pond :) The host was so helpful and very responsive when I had questions. There is some construction next door but Oleksandr was transparent about that from the beginning but we were too busy shopping, sight seeing etc. to really notice it. We will absolutely be visiting again!

Bed was comfortable and the additional touches of the decoration on the toilet paper and paper towels added that little extra touch. Construction is in process to build a wonderful restaurant and market place just in front of the building. Once it is finished it will make this airbnb that much better. Construction noises were not too loud and the host was very up front about it ahead of time. Definitely a great place to stay!

Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place is tucked away on a private street in a really cute neighborhood that has lots of bars, restaurants, and coffee shops. The hot tub is very nice, has privacy, and operates well. The apartment is well decorated, the climate control works great, and the bed is comfortable, but accessibility-wise, the bathroom is incredibly small (and definitely needs some hooks and towel racks added,) and the staircase up to the bedroom/bathroom has narrow steps and no bannister for the top steps.
Construction is happening across the alley way that is very close to the house, so you can expect noise at 7am on a Saturday from 12 feet away, which we could live with, but weren't thrilled about and would have brought earplugs to deal with. We booked this spot very far in advance, so we were not warned about this until the day of our arrival. The host apologized for any inconvenience, but I likely would not have paid what I paid for this spot knowing it would include a lot of noise.

review_text:
The space was neat and clean. The bed was comfortable and the bedroom had a super cute deck. We also thoroughly enjoyed the hot tub. I didn’t need to reach out about anything because the host sent messages proactively. There was construction going on on the street of the apartment and the host reached out about an alternate way to get there, which was very helpful. Check in and check out was super
easy. In-house instructions were very helpful such as where to find certain light switches, how remotes functioned, etc. Super close to restaurants and shops in German Village. We walked everywhere. All basic immunities were included and adequate but there really weren’t any special touches. It’s not absolutely necessary to go that extra mile, but we have stayed at places that do. I would suggest at bare minimum an addition of a towel rack for the hand towel in the bathroom and ice trays for the freezer.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place is great, and the most impressive thing that stood out was the informative construction update prior to booking. We have had several experiences in the past where we arrived to find very noisy construction, and we were quite frustrated! In this situation we were informed fully prior to booking, and we decided hot tub won over construction so went anyway. The hot tub is awesome and the construction was surprisingly not very loud, as the house is well insulated. The hosts were very helpful with a few questions in a timely manner. The only thing that could have been improved upon was the kitchen supply, as there are no staples at all such as spices. However, with plenty of tasty places to eat nearby to walk to, we never cooked! Stay here, you will be happy you did!

review_text: I’m so glad I found this hidden treasure of a place. It truly is a get away from the rest of the world. Finding it however was kinda tricky but once we did it became second nature. The hot tub was so amazing, well kept, and relaxing. The living room had so much charm and character. It made evenings watching movies on the couch feel so cozy and intimate. The kitchen was spacious , modern, and beautiful. The bed in the bedroom was incredibly comfortable… I wanna know where to pillows came from lol. The walk out balcony was such a bonus and great place to have morning coffee. Bathroom was spotless, clean, and modern. The study was my favorite room. However the ceiling fan light was not connected and the only light available in that room is natural light and a table lamp, which happened to be enough light for me. Again the study had so much charm and character. Thanks for an amazing stay, and allowing us to explore Columbus and what is had to offer!!!!

We highly recommend Katalina’s for breakfast, Plank’s on Parsons for bar pizza, The Brown Bag Delicatessen deli, Pistacia Vera bakery, The Book Loft to admire 32 rooms of books, and Schiller Park for a scenic stroll.
The Airbnb itself is lovely. It was well stocked with what we needed, very specious and clean, and the hot tub was a huge bonus. We would come back in a heartbeat!

review_text: We were visiting family and friends in Columbus and needed a clean, comfortable place to stay. Since I grew up in this city but have not spent much time in the downtown area recently, we decided to try out German Village. Ashley and Dru have such a terrific place that is very centrally located. The loft is very spacious, modern and comfortable. In fact, this place is one of the nicest places we have found anywhere with airbnb. When we were coming into town, our hosts allowed us enter the apartment early to get ready for all the festivities that we were celebrating. There is even a washer and dryer that was most beneficial to our needs at the time. For those who need to work from home, there is a separate loft with a desk. The kitchen is huge and very well stocked if you need to cook meals while there. A dedicated coffee bar with more kinds of coffee than you could even imagine are included with your stay. This location is so central and perfect for getting all over town!!!

We had a spate of car trouble as we were trying to leave home in Virginia, so we were exhausted on arrival. But the first thing that made us smile after all that was opening the door to the loft and seeing that it looked as beautiful as advertised!
The place was immaculate. The decor was not overdone — simple but absolutely lovely. There were nice touches everywhere. The handwritten welcome note, cute coasters, and the most concise and easy-to-read house rules book ever. But I particularly loved the embossing on the start of the paper towel and toilet paper rolls-something we have never seen before!
Before you leave town, check out Schmidt’s for dinner (Ashley’s recommendation). Wunderbar!

You won't be disappointed with the Luftig Loft! We had such a nice time. The updated loft is beautifully decorated and has everything you need for a relaxing stay. This place is pristine! We enjoyed the local coffee which was provided and loved that the hand soap, shampoo, etc was all from a local shop nearby. Plenty of luxurious linens provided. There's even a washer and dryer with detergent and softener provided. The bedroom suite was comfortable and cozy with a gas fireplace to boot. We made breakfast each morning and had all we needed to prepare everything.
Ashley communicated effortlessly with me and answered many questions as well as giving us many recommendations of places to visit. We didn't need to contact her during our stay but we new she was available at any time.
The loft is in a great location and walkable to many restaurants. German Village is quaint and welcoming. We loved it.
Go ahead and book this one. Perfection! You won't be disappointed!

review_text:
This place was not quite as nice as it seemed from the ad, smaller than it looks. The couch itself was extremely uncomfortable, and very cheap.
The bed however was excellent.
Also the hot water is that way too high, scalding hot.
They could've done a better job cleaning, and I think this place would really benefit if the owner stayed here themselves for a weekend or something.
Many little amenities that you would normally expect were not present.
Adding a tall floor lamp in the living room, and a couple extra wastebaskets would go a long way.
There is a Goodwill nearby, the owner could spend about $200 there and completely set this place up. They had several couches that were much better than what was in the unit.
Lots of places to eat in walking distance, a drugstore, gas station, Goodwill, and other things within a block or so.
The air conditioning situation is mixed, with three quality room air conditioners that will totally keep this place cool, but they are a bit

,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: These hosts have it figured out! I mean who leaves lavender calming mist on the nightstand. Space was meticulously clean and very comfortable. Towels, comforter, bed, blankets (fuzzy btw!), couch were all so comfortable. Not your typical Airbnb "house showing" set up. It was like staying at your best girlfriend's house and you end up borrowing her hair dryer, straightener and even her hairspray! I was very appreciative that they thought of all the amenities! They have a guest book with local eats and we used that for every place we ate out. The sushi two blocks down was amazing. It was actually very quiet and private for being so close to a main street. Uber was always only a couple of minutes away too. Like other reviewers have said, the stairs are really steep. Watch your phone on the way down! Oh, I almost forgot the shower head! I mean really, what a nice touch! If ever in Columbus again, I know where we're going back. Thanks Justyn and Grace!

It was mostly quite and peaceful during my stay. I think the complimentary items such as shower washes, coffee, creamer, feminine hygiene products, and etc. I truly appreciated the cleanliness of the home and the communication through the owners was excellent. review_text:
Either the host double booked my room or he never changed the keypad code for my room. 4 days after staying there someone else used a key code to enter my room while I was sleeping. Then the host said it wasn’t a big deal. I told him I’m contacting Airbnb, he got upset and put me out in the dead of the night. I had to be at work by 630a the next morning. It is not safe there and the host is beyond rude and inconsiderate.
A side from that incident. He has bed beds that have springs and very uncomfortable. A pillow top or memory foam would work best. And lastly there’s so many rules including no shoes, tiptoe through the house, quietly shut your door. Like you’re in boot camp.
Worst Airbnb host ever. Buyer beware.

Rating, 1 star

November 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
Ask what room you are getting first. If it is room 3 or 4 possibly 5. I would cancell immediately. The sound travels hard in that place so when other guests may be going in and out of their rooms and they are not mindful of how they close their door, you will hear this in your sleep. It will wake you.
I say cancel immediately because the host will try and work with you before handing any of your money back even when services have not been rendered. He will keep sending automated messages to you even when you've told him youre no longer staying at his airbnb.
Had to leave the airbnb for other noisy guests not following the house rules (Quiet time and no door slamming). Host wanted me to work with him to kick them out but I am not getting paid for that. So I had to leave in order to not make the situation more unbearable and was a hassle getting partially refunded (even with documentation). I would recommend staying here if you want to trade in peace and quiet for a cheap bargain.

Rating, 4 stars

·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: This is a large home, and it is used possibly exclusively as an AirBnB revenue generator. There are at least 5 bedrooms inside. We were assigned a room. Each has a number and combination lock. The furniture was fun, and it felt very welcoming. We took advantage of the big screen to watch a program we AirPlayed from an iPad, and reclined in the amazing sectional. The kitchen made me wish we'd planned to use it as well. Because there are other guests in the rooms, we mostly all kept to ourselves, so it felt a little "dorm-like" hearing other doors open, people wander about, and return to their rooms. We were friendly with those we encountered, but none of them seemed overly friendly. The bathroom was a community affair, which I guess I missed in the mix. It wasn't a problem, but I was left with concerns about conflicts of time usage, since going in and locking the door was the only mechanism for us. Great house, location, and neighborhood overall.

rating_info:

,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text: I had a great long-term stay in this Airbnb. The house as a whole is very nice and felt very roomy. The neighborhood is a wonderfully green, quiet, residential area that is nevertheless not too far from restaurants, shops, some major roads. The university campus is close by as well and public transit is easy to access. The beds are very comfortable and I appreciated having ample storage space in the closet. I also absolutely loved having access to a washer and dryer in the house, and the appliances are new and work very well. The other guests were quiet and respectful and the house was kept extremely clean which I really appreciated. The common areas and backyard are set up really nicely, and the kitchen is well-equipped for cooking. The room gets some natural light and there are skylights and lots of windows in the house. Check in and check out were both easy and the host was accessible and very easy to communicate with. All in all this airbnb was great for my needs.
